LIST.otherInformation: Analgesosedation in mechanically ventilated patients. Supplemental boluses of 500micrograms – 1mg may be administered if required. Nursing staff must document bolus doses on observation chart. Bolus doses plus infusion doses should not exceed hourly limits on prescription

"Sedative. Document any additional bolus doses administered.
ECMO patients: 5mg/ml sometimes used (250mg in 50ml {neat} via syringe pump)"

"Sedative. Document any additional bolus doses administered.
ECMO patients: 5mg/ml sometimes used (250mg in 50ml {neat} via syringe pump)"
Analgesosedation in mechanically ventilated patients. DO NOT BOLUS

Analgesosedation in mechanically ventilated patients.
Supplemental boluses of 1mg may be administered if required. Staff must document bolus doses; bolus doses plus infusion dose must not exceed hourly limits on prescription

LIST.rate: 0.5 to 2.5mg/kg/hr (sometimes expressed as 8-45 mcg/kg/minute) [higher doses may be indicated if high sedation requirements or for seizure control]
LIST.otherInformation: Sedative with bronchodilator properties. Intubated patients only. In patients with a cardiac history (esp ischaemic), infusion should be increased cautiously due effects on myocardial oxygen demand and risk of hypertension. Consider background of BDZ or propofol due to likelihood of hallucinations with ketamine
LIST.drugnameunit: Ketamine for bronchospasm and/or sedation 500mg in 50ml  (mg/kg/hr)
LIST.drugAndRoute: Ketamine for bronchospasm and/or sedation -  Infusion

LIST.rate: After IV trial: initially 0.1mg/kg/hour, can be increased to 0.2mg/kg/hour after 4-6hours (if indicated by pain and if tolerated)
LIST.otherInformation:
For complex pain:

Note: the doses for complex pain are significantly lower than the doses used for 
anaesthesia or bronchospasm. Use only under Pain Team/Anaesthetist advice.

A Ketamine trial must first be undertaken by an anaesthetist - bolus doses of 2.5-3mg aliquots, every 5 minutes, until pain is mild (maximum dose for trial is 10 mg). If trial successful, can start infusion.

LIST.rate: Usual rate between 25-400microg/hr Much variation – up to 10microgram/kg/hr may be required
LIST.otherInformation: Analgesosedation in mechanically ventilated patients. Supplemental boluses of 25 to 50micrograms may be administered if required. Must document bolus doses on observation chart. Bolus doses plus infusion doses should not exceed hourly limits on prescription

LIST.choiceOf: Use 25mg/50ml ready to use vials if available. If diluting concentrated 5mg/1ml amps, dilute with Glucose 5% or NaCl 0.9%
LIST.otherInformation: Analgesosedation in mechanically ventilated patients. Supplemental boluses of 500micrograms – 1mg may be administered if required. Nursing staff must document bolus doses on observation chart. Bolus doses plus infusion doses should not exceed hourly limits on prescription
